name: Viquiresumechallenge
body:
# viquiresumechallenge Maria Victoria Carballo

Maria Victoria Carballo

Residence 3129 36th avenue south Minneapolis, MN 55406
Phone (612) 385-0854
Email: mvcarballo@gmail.com

Objective

  Bilingual professional with more than 10 years of experience working as a liaison for the Hispanic community and diverse cultures. Enjoy and excel working in collaborative team environment. Possess excellent written and oral communication skills.

Experience

Bilingual Associate Educator

  August 2009 to Present
Sanford Middle School, Minneapolis, Mn
  • Serve as liaison between Sanford middle school and the Latino students and their families.
  • Provide academic support through the translation of policies and development of written contracts.
  • Maintain an open door policy and provide interpretation for students, families and the school.
  • Lead workshops for families new to Sanford to aid in the transition from elementary school.
  • Piloted Heritage Spanish class for Latino students.
  • Collaborate with school administrators to create Spanish language materials.
  • Developed and taught the curriculum for Heritage Spanish level 1 and 2.

Bilingual Associate Educator

  August 2005 to Febuary 2008
Folwell Middle School, Minneapolis, Mn
  • Piloted and taught Spanish literacy class to native Spanish speaking students.
  • Responsible for the translation of school materials, policies, announcements and newsletter.
  • Supervised lunchroom, hallways, uniform dress code, after school detention and in house suspension.
  • Promoted conflict resolution interactions with students through mediation and arbitration.
  • Worked with staff and parents to help promote a safe learning environment for students.

Group Mentor

  July 2003 to August 2004
Saint Olaf College (TRIO/Student Support Services), Northfield, MN
  • Mentored students in the transition from high school to college academics and social life.
  • Planned, organized and implemented social and academic activities.
  • Supervised and mentored students to ensure a positive and safe summer experience.

Education

  Bachelor of Arts in Hispanic Studies — May 2005
Saint Olaf College, Northfield,Mn

  Master of Arts in Special Education
University of Saint Thomas, St Paul, MN
